landing.description1: The online tool for submitting and resolving your BC Violation Ticket disputes.
landing.description2: If you would like to simply pay for your ticket, please click on the 'Pay Now' button.

step_1.heading: Initiate Dispute
step_1.detail: Login using your BC Services card and initiate the online resolution process.

step_2.heading: Violation Ticket Lookup
step_2.detail: Find your Violation Ticket and ensure that the specifics of the ticket are correct. Through our step-by-step process, you can indicate your preferences and how you would like the ticket to be disputed.

step_3.heading: Violation Ticket Resolution
step_3.detail: Submit your resolution or save the details until you are ready to proceed with the resolution process. You have 365 days to dispute your ticket from the date the ticket was issued.

self_resolution.heading: Self Resolution Wizard
self_resolution.detail: Interact with an online wizard and explore reasons behind your ticket. The online wizard will take you through multiple options demonstrated through text, videos and images.

find.heading: Find Your BC Traffic Ticket
find.sub_heading: Enter the Violation Ticket Number and the Violation Time to find your ticket.
find.note_forms: Forms are available on the website at

summary.heading: Summary of your BC Traffic Ticket
summary.sub_heading: Summary of your ticket and any disputes that exist.
summary.ticket_outstanding_detail: See below to find out more information about your ticket.
summary.dispute_status_1: The dispute has been filed. An email with the court information will be sent soon.
summary.dispute_status_2: A court date has been set for this dispute. Check your email for more information.
summary.questions_detail_1: Any further questions about your dispute should be directed to:

disputant.heading: Disputant Information
disputant.sub_heading: Please fill in the following information.
disputant.note: A notice of hearing will be mailed to the above address. You MUST notify the Violation Ticket Centre of any new address of change of address in writing.

count.heading: Count Review and Action
count.dispute_yes_no: I would like to dispute this offence
count.offence_agreement_1: I agree that I committed this offence, and I do not want to appear in court
count.offence_agreement_2: I agree that I committed this offence, and I want to appear in court
count.offence_agreement_3: I do not agree that I committed this offence (allegation)
count.requests: Which requests would you like to make?
count.requestReduction: I request a reduction of the ticketed amount: and/or
count.requestReductionReasonLabel: What are your reasons for a reduction in the ticketed amount(s)?
count.requestMoreTime: I request time to pay the ticketed amount
count.requestMoreTimeReasonLabel: What are your reasons for requiring more time to pay the ticketed amount(s)?

additional.heading: Additional Information
additional.sub_heading: The following questions apply to ALL counts on this ticket that are currently under dispute. If any of these are required for any count in the dispute, please select them.
additional.requests: Please indicate if the following apply
additional.lawyer: I intend to be represented at the hearing by a lawyer.
additional.interpreter: I require a speaking interpreter at the hearing.
additional.witness: I intend to call a witness.
additional.note: If the disputant or the disputantâ€™s agent does not attend the court hearing, the court will treat the violation ticket as not disputed, the conviction(s) to the allegation(s) will be recorded against the record of the disputant, and the prescribed ticketed amount(s) will become immediately due and payable.

overview.heading: Dispute Overview
overview.sub_heading: Please review the following information. You can go back to any step to update the information.
overview.offence_not_included: This offence is NOT included in the dispute
overview.offence_dispute: I do want to dispute this offence
overview.certify: I certify that all information provided is true and complete. I understand it is an offence under the law to knowingly provide false or misleading information.
overview.note_detail: Once it has been submitted, it cannot be updated.

submit.heading: BC Traffic Ticket Dispute Submitted
submit.note_detail: Your dispute was successfully submitted. Please check your email (including your Junk folder) for updates.
submit.next_steps_detail_1: Your Dispute is now under by the Traffic Courts. You will be notified once your dispute has been reviewed.
submit.next_steps_detail_2: Question about your dispute should be directed to

label.violation_ticket_number_hint: A Violation Ticket Number is 2 letters and 8 numbers

submit_confirmation.heading: Submit Dispute
submit_confirmation.message: When your dispute of the offence is submitted for adjudication, it can no longer be updated. Are you ready to submit your dispute?

toaster.dispute_validation_error: Your dispute has an error that needs to be corrected before you will be able to submit
